intro: Pertya triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed pertya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three distinct lobes, and its flowers are usually yellow or orange with a prominent central tube. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
